title: RealNetworks (RNWK) Earns Media Sentiment Rating of 0.02
content: Media stories about RealNetworks (NASDAQ:RNWK) have been trending somewhat positive on Saturday, according to Accern. Accern rates the sentiment of press coverage by monitoring more than twenty million blog and news sources in real-time. Accern ranks coverage of public companies on a scale of -1 to 1, with scores nearest to one being the most favorable. RealNetworks earned a news impact score of 0.02 on Accern’s scale. Accern also assigned news stories about the technology company an impact score of 46.0029462137279 out of 100, indicating that recent press coverage is somewhat unlikely to have an impact on the stock’s share price in the next several days.   Separately, ValuEngine raised RealNetworks from a “hold” rating to a “buy” rating in a report on Wednesday, May 2nd. RealNetworks traded up $0.01, reaching $3.56, on Friday, according to MarketBeat. The company’s stock had a trading volume of 69,203 shares, compared to its average volume of 118,599. RealNetworks has a fifty-two week low of $2.63 and a fifty-two week high of $5.00.   RealNetworks (NASDAQ:RNWK) last issued its quarterly earnings data on Thursday, May 3rd. The technology company reported ($0.14) earnings per share for the quarter. RealNetworks had a negative net margin of 11.87% and a negative return on equity of 21.20%. The firm had revenue of $19.65 million during the quarter.   In other news, Chairman Robert Glaser acquired 9,522 shares of RealNetworks stock in a transaction on Wednesday, May 9th. The stock was bought at an average price of $3.50 per share, for a total transaction of $33,327.00. The acquisition was disclosed in a legal filing with the Securities & Exchange Commission, which is available at this hyperlink. In the last quarter, insiders acquired 148,612 shares of company stock valued at $500,286. 37.90% of the stock is owned by company insiders.   About RealNetworks  RealNetworks, Inc provides network-delivered digital media applications and services to manage, play, and share digital media. Its Consumer Media segment offers RealPlayer media player software, which enables consumers to discover, play, download, manage and edit digital video, stream audio and video, download and save photos and videos from the Web, transfer and share content on social networks, and edit their own photo and video content.
